intro: Cacalia filigera, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, silver-tan foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cacalia filigera is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various herbal remedies.
